title: Niki Poonacha:Meet Niki Poonacha, The Man Who Battled Injuries And Financial Hurdles To Become A National Tennis Champion
text:
Meet Niki Poonacha, The Man Who Battled Injuries And Financial Hurdles To Become A National Tennis Champion

Meet Niki Poonacha, The Man Who Battled Injuries And Financial Hurdles To Become A National Tennis Champion

Nicky Poonacha is 24, but it has seemed like an eternity for him to get going on court. However, things are finally looking up and that is a good thing. The man was just crowned National Champion, but the journey has not been rosy.

His body suffered and months were lost in training due to injuries. Then he had to stop his training in Spain due to lack of financial resources. Even though his parents had sold off most of their properties to sponsor his tennis career, it was not enough at that stage.

Fenesta Open

At 18, Niki decided to become a professional. But 2 years later reality hit hard and he had to stop.

Then things changed when he was spotted at an ITF junior tournament by Rohan Bopanna in 2016.

PTI

“When he was starting his academy, one of his coaches invited me to join. From having nothing to having a very good professional set up, it was a big turning point for me,” said Niki in a Hindustan Times report.

"My main priority is to stay healthy and focus on my fitness. And from next season, I want to play close to 25 tournaments a year. Long term, my dream is to be in the top 100, and represent India in the Davis Cup,” he added.

He is currently ranked 912 in the ATP rankings and now hopes to make an impact on the international circuit. Here's wishing him the best of luck.
